member.name: T:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkConfig
member.summary:
Holds the client configuration necessary to communicate with the mechanical turk webservice. A MTurkConfig instance must be passed to the or instance to establish connectivity.
The DefaultInstance can be used when the configuration is retrieved from the application configuration file. If the configuration is stored elsewhere, a separate MTurkConfig instance must be instantiated and passed to the requester.

member.name: F:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkConfig._context
member.summary: Additional key-value-pairs that can be passed into the SDK when the configuration was not loaded from the application configuration file

member.name: F:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkConfig._currentInstance
member.summary: The configuration used in the current thread

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates the client configuration by reading the application configuration file (app.config).
member.remarks:
The following values are read from the application configuration file:
MechanicalTurk.ServiceEndpoint
The service endpoint receiving and processing mturk requests. Defaults to the sandbox endpoint at https://mechanicalturk.sandbox.amazonaws.com?Service=AWSMechanicalTurkRequester
MechanicalTurk.AccessKeyId Required: The access key ID for the Amazon Web Services account
MechanicalTurk.SecretAccessKey Required: The secret access key for the Amazon Web Services account
MechanicalTurk.Log.Level The log level for SDK log messages ( for details). Defaults to 2 (Info)
MechanicalTurk.Proxy.Url
Proxy URL (only necessary when used through a web proxy that requires authentication)
MechanicalTurk.Proxy.User

member.name: T:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient
member.summary: Core client used to invoke soap operations on the Mechanical Turk endpoint with a set of client credentials.
member.remarks: By default, the credentials are stored in the application configuration file. If credentials are stored elsewhere or the application requires multiple connections with different credentials, the MTurkClient(MTurkConfig config) constructor can be used to do this.

member.name: T:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations
member.summary: Interface for Mechanical Turk SOAP operations.
member.remarks:
Detailed information about the operations and their parameters are maintained on
Amazon Mechanical Turk Developer Guide site.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.ApproveAssignment(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ApproveAssignmentRequest)
member.summary: The ApproveAssignment operation approves the results of a completed assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Approving an assignment initiates two payments from the Requester's Amazon.com account: the Worker that submitted the results is paid the reward specified in the HIT, and Mechanical Turk fees are debited. If the Requester's account does not have adequate funds for these payments, the call to ApproveAssignment will return an exception, and the approval will not be processed.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.AssignQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.AssignQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The AssignQualification operation gives a Worker a Qualification. AssignQualification does not require that the Worker submit a Qualification request: It gives the Qualification directly to the Worker.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: You can assign a Qualification to any Worker that has submitted one of your HITs in the past. You can only assign a Qualification of a Qualification type that you created.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.CreateHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.CreateHITRequest)
member.summary: The CreateHIT operation creates a new HIT. The new HIT is made available for Workers to find and accept on the Mechanical Turk web site.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Once a HIT has been created, it cannot be deleted. A HIT may be removed from the web site using the DisableHIT operation, but Workers that have already accepted the HIT will still be allowed to submit results to claim rewards. See DisableHIT for more information.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.CreateQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.CreateQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The CreateQualificationType operation creates a new Qualification type.
member.remarks: Every Qualification has a Qualification type. The creator of the type can assign Qualifications of that type to Workers, and grant requests for Qualifications of the type made by Workers. A Qualification can be considered a statement about a Worker made by the Qualification type's owner. A Qualification type may include a Qualification test, a set of questions a Worker must answer to request the Qualification. The type may also include an answer key for the test. Qualification requests for types with answer keys are granted automatically by Mechanical Turk, using a value calculated from the answer key and the Worker's test answers. If the Qualification type does not have a test, or does not have an answer key, the type's owner is responsible for polling for and granting Qualification requests.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.DisableHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.DisableHITRequest)
member.summary: The DisableHIT operation removes a HIT from the Mechanical Turk marketplace, approves all submitted assignments that have not already been approved or rejected, and disposes of the HIT and all assignment data.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Assignments for the HIT that have already been submitted, but not yet approved or rejected, will be automatically approved. Assignments in progress at the time of the call to DisableHIT will be approved once the assignments are submitted. You will be charged for approval of these assignments.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.DisposeHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.DisposeHITRequest)
member.summary: The DisposeHIT operation disposes of a HIT that is no longer needed.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Only HITs in the "reviewable" state, with all submitted assignments approved or rejected, can be disposed. A Requester can call GetReviewableHITs to determine which HITs are reviewable, then call GetAssignmentsForHIT to retrieve the assignments. Disposing of a HIT removes the HIT from the results of a call to GetReviewableHITs. If DisposeHIT is called on a HIT that is not "reviewable" (that has not expired or has active assignments), or on a HIT that is "reviewable" but not all of the submitted assignments have been approved or rejected, the service will return an error.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.ExtendHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ExtendHITRequest)
member.summary: The ExtendHIT operation increases the maximum number of assignments, or extends the expiration date, of an existing HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: If a HIT is not assignable (with a status of Unassignable or Reviewable) due to either having reached its maximum number of assignments or having reached its expiration date, extending the HIT can make it available again.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.ForceExpireHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ForceExpireHITRequest)
member.summary: The ForceExpireHIT operation causes a HIT to expire immediately, as if the HIT's LifetimeInSeconds had elapsed.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The effect is identical to the HIT expiring on its own: The HIT no longer appears on the Mechanical Turk web site, and no new Workers are allowed to accept the HIT. Workers who have accepted the HIT prior to expiration are allowed to complete it or return it, or allow the assignment duration to elapse (abandon the HIT). Once all remaining assignments have been submitted, the expired HIT becomes "reviewable", and will be returned by a call to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetAccountBalance(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetAccountBalanceRequest)
member.summary: The GetAccountBalance operation retrieves the amount of money your Amazon Mechanical Turk account, as well as the amount of money "on hold" pending the completion of transfers from your bank account to your Amazon account.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetAssignmentsForHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetAssignmentsForHITRequest)
member.summary: The GetAssignmentsForHIT operation retrieves completed assignments for a HIT. You can use this operation to retrieve the results for a HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: You can get assignments for a HIT at any time, even if the HIT is not yet "reviewable". If a HIT requested multiple assignments, and has received some results but has not yet become "reviewable", you can still retrieve the partial results with GetAssignmentsForHIT.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetBonusPayments(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetBonusPaymentsRequest)
member.summary: The GetBonusPayments operation retrieves the amounts of bonuses you have paid to Workers for a given HIT or assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetFileUploadURL(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetFileUploadURLRequest)
member.summary: The GetFileUploadURL operation generates and returns a temporary URL for the purposes of retrieving a file uploaded by a Worker as an answer to a FileUploadAnswer question for a HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The temporary URL is generated the instant the GetFileUploadURL operation is called, and is valid for 60 seconds.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetHITRequest)
member.summary: The GetHIT operation retrieves the details of a HIT, using its HIT ID.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetHITsForQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetHITsForQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The GetHITsForQualificationType operation returns the HITs that use the given Qualification type for a Qualification requirement.
member.param: Type of the get HITs for qualification.
member.remarks:
The operation returns HITs of any status, except for HITs that have been disposed with the DisposeHIT operation.
Only HITs that you created will be returned by the query.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetQualificationsForQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationsForQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationsForQualificationType operation returns all of the Qualifications granted to Workers for a given Qualification type.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Results are divided into numbered "pages," and a single page of results is returned by the operation. Pagination can be controlled with parameters to the operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetQualificationRequests(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationRequestsRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationRequests operation retrieves requests for Qualifications of a particular Qualification type. The Qualification type's owner calls this operation to poll for pending requests, and grants Qualifications based on the requests using the GrantQualification operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks:
Only requests for Qualifications that require the type owner's attention are returned by GetQualificationRequests. Requests awaiting Qualification test answers, and requests that have already been granted, are not returned.
Only the owner of the Qualification type can retrieve its requests.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetQualificationScore(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationScoreRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationScore operation returns the value of a user's Qualification for a given Qualification type.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: To get a user's Qualification, you must know the user's ID. A Worker's user ID is included in the assignment data returned by the GetAssignmentsForHIT operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationType operation retrieves information about a Qualification type using its ID.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetRequesterStatistic(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetRequesterStatisticRequest)
member.summary: The GetRequesterStatistic operation retrieves the value of one of several statistics about you (the Requester calling the operation).
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks:
Mechanical Turk keeps track of many statistics about users and system activity. Statistics are calculated and recorded for each calendar day. GetRequesterStatistic can return data points for each of multiple days up to the current day, or an aggregate value for a longer time period up to the current day.
A single day's statistic represents the change in an overall value that has resulted from the day's activity. For example, the NumberAssignmentsApproved statistic reports the number of assignments you have approved in a given day. If you do not approve any assignments for a day, the value will be 0 for that day. If you approve fifty assignments that day, the value will be 50.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetReviewableHITs(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetReviewableHITsRequest)
member.summary: The GetReviewableHITs operation retrieves the HITs that have a status of Reviewable, or HITs that have a status of Reviewing, and that belong to the Requester calling the operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: You can use this operation to determine which of your HITs have results, then retrieve those results with the GetAssignmentsForHIT operation. Once a HIT's results have been retrieved and the assignments have been approved or rejected (with ApproveAssignment or RejectAssignment), you can call DisposeHIT to remove the HIT from the results of a call to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GetWorkerAcceptLimit(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetWorkerAcceptLimitRequest)
member.summary: The GetWorkerAcceptLimit operation retrieves the value of MaxWorkerAcceptLimit for the group you specify
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GrantBonus(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GrantBonusRequest)
member.summary: The GrantBonus operation issues a payment of money from your account to a Worker. To be eligible for a bonus, the Worker must have submitted results for one of your HITs, and have had those results approved or rejected. This payment happens separately from the reward you pay to the Worker when you approve the Worker's assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.GrantQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GrantQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The GrantQualification operation grants a user's request for a Qualification.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Only the owner of the Qualification type can grant a Qualification request for that type.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.Help(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.HelpRequest)
member.summary: The Help operation returns information about the Mechanical Turk Service operations and response groups. You can use it to facilitate development and documentation of your web site and tools.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.NotifyWorkers(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.NotifyWorkersRequest)
member.summary: The NotifyWorkers operation sends e-mail to one or more Workers, given the recipients' Worker IDs.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks:
Worker IDs are included in the assignment data returned by GetAssignmentsForHIT. You can send e-mail to any Worker who has ever submitted results for a HIT you created that you have approved or rejected.
The e-mail sent to Workers includes your e-mail address as the "reply-to" address, so Workers can respond to the e-mail

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.RegisterHITType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RegisterHITTypeRequest)
member.summary: The RegisterHITType operation creates a new HIT type, a set of HIT properties which can be used to create new HITs.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.returns: The ID of the new HIT type

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.RejectAssignment(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RejectAssignmentRequest)
member.summary: The RejectAssignment operation rejects the results of a completed assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Rejecting an assignment indicates that the Requester believes the results submitted by the Worker do not properly answer the question described by the HIT. The Worker is not paid for a rejected assignment.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.RejectQualificationRequest(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RejectQualificationRequestRequest)
member.summary: The RejectQualificationRequest operation rejects a user's request for a Qualification. Once a Qualification request is rejected, it will no longer be returned by a call to the GetQualificationRequests operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Rejecting the Qualification request does not change the user's Qualifications: If the user already has a Qualification of the corresponding Qualification type, the user will continue to have the Qualification with the previously assigned score. If the user does not have the Qualification, the user will still not have it after the request is rejected.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.RevokeQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RevokeQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The RevokeQualification operation revokes a previously granted Qualification from a user. If the user had a Qualification of the given Qualification type, after revoking it, the user will no longer have the Qualification, and will not qualify for HITs whose Qualification requirements say the user must have the Qualification.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Once a Qualification is revoked from a user, the user cannot be granted the Qualification until the user requests the Qualification again. Depending on how the Qualification type's retry policy is configured, the user may be restricted from requesting the Qualification a second time.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.SearchHITs(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SearchHITsRequest)
member.summary: The SearchHITs operation returns all of a Requester's HITs, on behalf of the Requester.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The operation returns HITs of any status, except for HITs that have been disposed with the DisposeHIT operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.SearchQualificationTypes(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SearchQualificationTypesRequest)
member.summary: The SearchQualificationTypes operation searches for Qualification types using the specified search query, and returns a list of Qualification types.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Results are sorted and divided into numbered "pages," and a single page of results is returned by the operation. Sorting and pagination can be controlled with parameters to the operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.SendTestEventNotification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SendTestEventNotificationRequest)
member.summary: The SendTestEventNotification operation causes Mechanical Turk to send a notification message as if a HIT event occurred, according to the provided notification specification. This allows you to test your notification receptor logic without setting up notifications for a real HIT type and trying to trigger them using the web site.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.SetHITAsReviewing(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SetHITAsReviewingRequest)
member.summary: The SetHITAsReviewing operation updates a HIT with a status of Reviewable to have a status of Reviewing, or reverts a Reviewing HIT back to the Reviewable status.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The Reviewable and Reviewing status values for a HIT control which HITs are returned by the GetReviewableHITs operation. A HIT's status is also returned with a HIT's data, such as by a call to the GetHIT operation. Your application can manipulate and query these status values as part of the HIT review process. For example, if verification for a HIT's results is pending further information, the HIT can be moved to the Reviewing status to prevent it from being returned by subsequent calls to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.ITurkOperations.SetHITTypeNotification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SetHITTypeNotificationRequest)
member.summary: The SetHITTypeNotification operation creates, updates, disables or re-enables notifications for a HIT type.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: When a HIT type has an active notification, Mechanical Turk will attempt to send a notification message when a HIT of the type changes state, such as when an assignment is submitted for the HIT. The state changes to watch and the method of notification are described in the notification specification given to SetHITTypeNotification.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.CreateHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.CreateHITRequest)
member.summary: The CreateHIT operation creates a new HIT. The new HIT is made available for Workers to find and accept on the Mechanical Turk web site.
member.param: The request parameters for this operation
member.remarks: Once a HIT has been created, it cannot be deleted. A HIT may be removed from the web site using the DisableHIT operation, but Workers that have already accepted the HIT will still be allowed to submit results to claim rewards. See DisableHIT for more information.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetHITRequest)
member.summary: The GetHIT operation retrieves the details of a HIT, using its HIT ID.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.DisableHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.DisableHITRequest)
member.summary: The DisableHIT operation removes a HIT from the Mechanical Turk marketplace, approves all submitted assignments that have not already been approved or rejected, and disposes of the HIT and all assignment data.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Assignments for the HIT that have already been submitted, but not yet approved or rejected, will be automatically approved. Assignments in progress at the time of the call to DisableHIT will be approved once the assignments are submitted. You will be charged for approval of these assignments.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.ExtendHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ExtendHITRequest)
member.summary: The ExtendHIT operation increases the maximum number of assignments, or extends the expiration date, of an existing HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: If a HIT is not assignable (with a status of Unassignable or Reviewable) due to either having reached its maximum number of assignments or having reached its expiration date, extending the HIT can make it available again.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.ForceExpireHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ForceExpireHITRequest)
member.summary: The ForceExpireHIT operation causes a HIT to expire immediately, as if the HIT's LifetimeInSeconds had elapsed.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The effect is identical to the HIT expiring on its own: The HIT no longer appears on the Mechanical Turk web site, and no new Workers are allowed to accept the HIT. Workers who have accepted the HIT prior to expiration are allowed to complete it or return it, or allow the assignment duration to elapse (abandon the HIT). Once all remaining assignments have been submitted, the expired HIT becomes "reviewable", and will be returned by a call to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.DisposeHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.DisposeHITRequest)
member.summary: The DisposeHIT operation disposes of a HIT that is no longer needed.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Only HITs in the "reviewable" state, with all submitted assignments approved or rejected, can be disposed. A Requester can call GetReviewableHITs to determine which HITs are reviewable, then call GetAssignmentsForHIT to retrieve the assignments. Disposing of a HIT removes the HIT from the results of a call to GetReviewableHITs. If DisposeHIT is called on a HIT that is not "reviewable" (that has not expired or has active assignments), or on a HIT that is "reviewable" but not all of the submitted assignments have been approved or rejected, the service will return an error.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.SearchHITs(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SearchHITsRequest)
member.summary: The SearchHITs operation returns all of a Requester's HITs, on behalf of the Requester.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The operation returns HITs of any status, except for HITs that have been disposed with the DisposeHIT operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetReviewableHITs(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetReviewableHITsRequest)
member.summary: The GetReviewableHITs operation retrieves the HITs that have a status of Reviewable, or HITs that have a status of Reviewing, and that belong to the Requester calling the operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: You can use this operation to determine which of your HITs have results, then retrieve those results with the GetAssignmentsForHIT operation. Once a HIT's results have been retrieved and the assignments have been approved or rejected (with ApproveAssignment or RejectAssignment), you can call DisposeHIT to remove the HIT from the results of a call to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.RegisterHITType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RegisterHITTypeRequest)
member.summary: The RegisterHITType operation creates a new HIT type, a set of HIT properties which can be used to create new HITs.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.returns: The ID of the new HIT type

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.SetHITTypeNotification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SetHITTypeNotificationRequest)
member.summary: The SetHITTypeNotification operation creates, updates, disables or re-enables notifications for a HIT type.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: When a HIT type has an active notification, Mechanical Turk will attempt to send a notification message when a HIT of the type changes state, such as when an assignment is submitted for the HIT. The state changes to watch and the method of notification are described in the notification specification given to SetHITTypeNotification.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.SetHITAsReviewing(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SetHITAsReviewingRequest)
member.summary: The SetHITAsReviewing operation updates a HIT with a status of Reviewable to have a status of Reviewing, or reverts a Reviewing HIT back to the Reviewable status.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The Reviewable and Reviewing status values for a HIT control which HITs are returned by the GetReviewableHITs operation. A HIT's status is also returned with a HIT's data, such as by a call to the GetHIT operation. Your application can manipulate and query these status values as part of the HIT review process. For example, if verification for a HIT's results is pending further information, the HIT can be moved to the Reviewing status to prevent it from being returned by subsequent calls to GetReviewableHITs.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetHITsForQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetHITsForQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The GetHITsForQualificationType operation returns the HITs that use the given Qualification type for a Qualification requirement.
member.param: Type of the get HITs for qualification.
member.remarks:
The operation returns HITs of any status, except for HITs that have been disposed with the DisposeHIT operation.
Only HITs that you created will be returned by the query.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.SendTestEventNotification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.SendTestEventNotificationRequest)
member.summary: The SendTestEventNotification operation causes Mechanical Turk to send a notification message as if a HIT event occurred, according to the provided notification specification. This allows you to test your notification receptor logic without setting up notifications for a real HIT type and trying to trigger them using the web site.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.summary: The GetQualificationsForQualificationType operation returns all of the Qualifications granted to Workers for a given Qualification type.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Results are divided into numbered "pages," and a single page of results is returned by the operation. Pagination can be controlled with parameters to the operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.ApproveAssignment(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.ApproveAssignmentRequest)
member.summary: The ApproveAssignment operation approves the results of a completed assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Approving an assignment initiates two payments from the Requester's Amazon.com account: the Worker that submitted the results is paid the reward specified in the HIT, and Mechanical Turk fees are debited. If the Requester's account does not have adequate funds for these payments, the call to ApproveAssignment will return an exception, and the approval will not be processed.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.RejectAssignment(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RejectAssignmentRequest)
member.summary: The RejectAssignment operation rejects the results of a completed assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Rejecting an assignment indicates that the Requester believes the results submitted by the Worker do not properly answer the question described by the HIT. The Worker is not paid for a rejected assignment.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetAssignmentsForHIT(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetAssignmentsForHITRequest)
member.summary: The GetAssignmentsForHIT operation retrieves completed assignments for a HIT. You can use this operation to retrieve the results for a HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: You can get assignments for a HIT at any time, even if the HIT is not yet "reviewable". If a HIT requested multiple assignments, and has received some results but has not yet become "reviewable", you can still retrieve the partial results with GetAssignmentsForHIT.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetFileUploadURL(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetFileUploadURLRequest)
member.summary: The GetFileUploadURL operation generates and returns a temporary URL for the purposes of retrieving a file uploaded by a Worker as an answer to a FileUploadAnswer question for a HIT.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: The temporary URL is generated the instant the GetFileUploadURL operation is called, and is valid for 60 seconds.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GrantBonus(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GrantBonusRequest)
member.summary: The GrantBonus operation issues a payment of money from your account to a Worker. To be eligible for a bonus, the Worker must have submitted results for one of your HITs, and have had those results approved or rejected. This payment happens separately from the reward you pay to the Worker when you approve the Worker's assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetBonusPayments(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetBonusPaymentsRequest)
member.summary: The GetBonusPayments operation retrieves the amounts of bonuses you have paid to Workers for a given HIT or assignment.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.CreateQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.CreateQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The CreateQualificationType operation creates a new Qualification type.
member.remarks: Every Qualification has a Qualification type. The creator of the type can assign Qualifications of that type to Workers, and grant requests for Qualifications of the type made by Workers. A Qualification can be considered a statement about a Worker made by the Qualification type's owner. A Qualification type may include a Qualification test, a set of questions a Worker must answer to request the Qualification. The type may also include an answer key for the test. Qualification requests for types with answer keys are granted automatically by Mechanical Turk, using a value calculated from the answer key and the Worker's test answers. If the Qualification type does not have a test, or does not have an answer key, the type's owner is responsible for polling for and granting Qualification requests.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GrantQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GrantQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The GrantQualification operation grants a user's request for a Qualification.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Only the owner of the Qualification type can grant a Qualification request for that type.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.AssignQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.AssignQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The AssignQualification operation gives a Worker a Qualification. AssignQualification does not require that the Worker submit a Qualification request: It gives the Qualification directly to the Worker.
member.param: The request parameters for this operation
member.remarks: You can assign a Qualification to any Worker that has submitted one of your HITs in the past. You can only assign a Qualification of a Qualification type that you created.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.RevokeQualification(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RevokeQualificationRequest)
member.summary: The RevokeQualification operation revokes a previously granted Qualification from a user. If the user had a Qualification of the given Qualification type, after revoking it, the user will no longer have the Qualification, and will not qualify for HITs whose Qualification requirements say the user must have the Qualification.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Once a Qualification is revoked from a user, the user cannot be granted the Qualification until the user requests the Qualification again. Depending on how the Qualification type's retry policy is configured, the user may be restricted from requesting the Qualification a second time.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetQualificationType(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationTypeRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationType operation retrieves information about a Qualification type using its ID.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetQualificationRequests(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationRequestsRequest)
member.summary: The GetQualificationRequests operation retrieves requests for Qualifications of a particular Qualification type. The Qualification type's owner calls this operation to poll for pending requests, and grants Qualifications based on the requests using the GrantQualification operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks:
Only requests for Qualifications that require the type owner's attention are returned by GetQualificationRequests. Requests awaiting Qualification test answers, and requests that have already been granted, are not returned.
Only the owner of the Qualification type can retrieve its requests.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.RejectQualificationRequest(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.RejectQualificationRequestRequest)
member.summary: The RejectQualificationRequest operation rejects a user's request for a Qualification. Once a Qualification request is rejected, it will no longer be returned by a call to the GetQualificationRequests operation.
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: Rejecting the Qualification request does not change the user's Qualifications: If the user already has a Qualification of the corresponding Qualification type, the user will continue to have the Qualification with the previously assigned score. If the user does not have the Qualification, the user will still not have it after th request is rejected.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetRequesterStatistic(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetRequesterStatisticRequest)
member.summary: The GetRequesterStatistic operation retrieves the value of one of several statistics about you (the Requester calling the operation).
member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks:
Mechanical Turk keeps track of many statistics about users and system activity. Statistics are calculated and recorded for each calendar day. GetRequesterStatistic can return data points for each of multiple days up to the current day, or an aggregate value for a longer time period up to the current day.
A single day's statistic represents the change in an overall value that has resulted from the day's activity. For example, the NumberAssignmentsApproved statistic reports the number of assignments you have approved in a given day. If you do not approve any assignments for a day, the value will be 0 for that day. If you approve fifty assignments that day, the value will be 50.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.MTurkClient.GetQualificationScore(Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Domain.GetQualificationScoreRequest)

member.param: A instance containing the request parameters
member.remarks: To get a user's Qualification, you must know the user's ID. A Worker's user ID is included in the assignment data returned by the GetAssignmentsForHIT operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.MTurkLog.Logger
member.summary: Sets the logger used to log SDK messages. By default, the a trace logger is used, but any other class implementing the can be set here to replace this default logger. As such it is easy to hook in other log mechanisms and frameworks such as log4net, the Microsoft logging application block or simply the event log.

member.name: P:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.MTurkLog.Level
member.summary:
Defined log levels are:
1 Debug (messages for debugging an application)
2
Info (messages that might be of interest to an application administrator)
3
Warn (messages that might indicate a potential problem)
4 Error (messages that indicate an error)
5None (no logging)
member.remarks: The default log level is 2 (Info). This default can be overridden either programmatically or through configuration by setting the "MechanicalTurk.Log.Level" key in the application configuration file (refer to for configuration details)

member.name: T:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.Advanced.TraceLogger
member.summary: Logs messages to the trace log. A can be used to capture this messages and output them to a custom sink.

member.name: T:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil
member.summary: Various reflection utility functions used in the SDK

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.CreateRequestEnvelope(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates the MTurk request envelope for a specific itemType (e.g. "CreateHIT" envelope for the "CreateHITRequest" item). The envelope is an object that contains the common AWS properties, such as access key ID etc.

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.PreProcessOptionalRequestProperties(System.Object)
member.summary:
Evaluates whether any optional properties in a request item have been set. If this is the case, then the correlating "Specified" property will be set to, otherwise the property does not get serialized in the soap request.
See e.g. http://blogs.msdn.com/eugeneos/archive/2007/02/05/solving-the-disappearing-data-issue-when-using-add-web-reference-or-wsdl-exe-with-wcf-services.aspx for more details (using WCF is out of question for the API)
member.param: Array of request items passed in an MTurk request (such as CreateItemRequest[])

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.SetPagingProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the common list properties (pagenumber/size) to defaults if they were not explicitly set. Applies only to list requests

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.Clone(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Shallow "clone": Clones the public properties from a source to a target object (of the same type)

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.GetPropertyPathValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value for a property path.
member.param: The root object for the path. Needs to be of the cached type
member.returns: The result for the property path or null, if any of the values in the path returned null

member.name: M:Amazon.WebServices.MechanicalTurk.ReflectionUtil.SetPropertyPathValue(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the property path value. If one of the properties in the path is null, a new instance for its type is created.
member.param: The root object for the path. Needs to be of the cached type
